ambient_light.name: Ambient Light is Too Low
ambient_light.note: You are trying to operate either before dawn or after sunset. Getting this warning at night is totally normal.
solutions: If flying at night, avoid flying the drone at speeds above 7 meters per second or 25.2 kilometers per hour.

arm_(ARM)_not_secured.name: Forgot to Securely Fasten the Arm (SAME[ARM]) Locking Piece Handle
solutions: Do not forget to secure the arm (SAME[ARM]) locking piece handle

excessive_loading.name: Excessive Loading
solutions: Do not load the aircraft with more than 35 liters.

kp_factor_too_high.name: KP Factor Too High
solutions: Check the KP factor using an app like UAV Forecast. If it is above 7, suspend operations and wait for the KP factor to decrease.

mission_radius_too_high.name: Mission Radius Too High
mission_radius_too_high.note: The mission radius is the maximum distance between the takeoff point and any point where the aircraft is supposed to fly. You are trying to send the aircraft to fly too far from the takeoff point.
solutions: Move the takeoff point to a place where the mission radius is smaller.

rtk_positioning_on.name: RTK Positioning is On
solutions: If you are not using an RTK antenna, turn off RTK positioning.
If you are using an RTK antenna, check that it is on and working properly.

takeoff_area_too_tight.name: Takeoff Area is Too Tight
solutions: Turn the aircraft off, rotate it 90 degrees, and restart it.
Move the takeoff point to an area with more clearance, where the GNSS antennas can acquire more satellites.

zone_altitude.name: Takeoff Area is In a Restricted Altitude Zone (150 meters)
solutions: Obey the warning and do not fly above 150 meter from the ground.

zone_restricted_or_warning.name: Takeoff Area is In a Restricted or Warning Zone
solutions: Contact your DJI dealer for information on how to unblock flight in this area.
